sentences.english: All three of us looked like spacemen.
sentences.chinese: 我们三个都看起来像太空人。

sentences.english: In the difficult mode, you have two spacemen to contend with.
sentences.chinese: 在困难的模态中，你需要同时操作二个太空人。

sentences.english: Astronauts and cosmonauts have stayed and worked here for long periods of time before returning to Earth.
sentences.chinese: 美国和苏联的太空人都曾在太空站上停留很长的时间。

sentences.english: All spacemen must be able to bear acceleration.
sentences.chinese: 所有太空人都应能承受加速度。

sentences.english: Sir, it's the same aliens that attacked us in the Omicron Sector.
sentences.chinese: 长官，它就是在奥米克戎区攻击我们的同一太空人。

sentences.english: Spacers have all kinds of trouble, Doc.
sentences.chinese: 太空人会遇上各种各样的麻烦，博士。

sentences.english: Mindy learned to be an astronaut while working at NASA.
sentences.chinese: 明帝在太空总署受训成为太空人。

sentences.english: The first flight of a taikonaut was a total success.
sentences.chinese: 中国太空人的首次太空飞行大获成功。

sentences.english: The spaceman has already landed on the moon.
Modern boys usually say that they want to be spacemen .
sentences.chinese: 现在的男孩子常说他们要当太空人。

sentences.english: It was even blasted into space with the country's first astronaut in 2008.
sentences.chinese: 泡菜也与2008年跟着南韩第一位太空人上太空。

sentences.english: He spent five years training to become a spaceman.
sentences.chinese: 在成为一名太空人前，他花了五年时间来训练。

sentences.english: Taikonaut is coined from the Chinese word for space.
sentences.chinese: 太空人一词，起源于中国文字“太空”。

sentences.english: The actors act better than those in Spacemen on Earth.
sentences.chinese: 演员演得比《地球上的太空人》里的更好。

sentences.english: Wheah's your redlines if you're such a hot spacer?
sentences.chinese: 如果说你是个太空人，你脸上的红线在哪儿呢？

definition: moon landing/to land on the moon
Yuri Gagarin (1934-1968), Russian cosmonaut, first human in space
US National Aeronautics and Space Administration/NASA
